com.sensiya.brainssdk.api

Class BrainsAPI.Analytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sensiya.brainssdk.api.BrainsAPI.Analytics
  • Enclosing class:
    BrainsAPI

    public static final class BrainsAPI.Analytics
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides event logging options.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void logEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName)
      Logs an event in Sensiya analytics system.
      Event name must be unique and will be later used to show you your analytic data.
      Examples of event names: "Pressed Share", "Passed Level" etc.

      In order to log events with parameters you can use logEvent(android.content.Context, String, java.util.HashMap).
      static void logEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> eventParams)
      Logs an event in Sensiya analytics system.
      Event name must be unique and will be later used to show you your analytic data.
      Event parameters can be used to provide extra information about the event.

    • Method Detail

      • logEvent

        public static void logEvent(android.content.Context context,
            java.lang.String eventName)
        Logs an event in Sensiya analytics system.
        Event name must be unique and will be later used to show you your analytic data.
        Examples of event names: "Pressed Share", "Passed Level" etc.

        In order to log events with parameters you can use logEvent(android.content.Context, String, java.util.HashMap).
        Parameters:
        context - application context.
        eventName - An unique event name.

      • logEvent

        public static void logEvent(android.content.Context context,
            java.lang.String eventName,
            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> eventParams)
        Logs an event in Sensiya analytics system.
        Event name must be unique and will be later used to show you your analytic data.
        Event parameters can be used to provide extra information about the event. The parameters are a string to string map.
        An event with parameters can be for example:
        EventName="Passed Level" EventParams={"levelNum": "9", "Difficulty": "Hard"}

        In order to log events without parameters you can use logEvent(android.content.Context, String).
        Parameters:
        context - application context.
        eventName - An unique event name.
        eventParams - Parameters that provide extra information about the event.
